testcase3.testname: read multibyte SJIS character from a file

script.testcase3.mksh:
#!/usr/bin/mksh
while read line
do
echo $line
done

testcase4.testname: The language configuration specified in a script should be retained

testcase5.testname: redirecting multibyte SJIS character as output using '>'
cmd:
cat > rd1 <<< '#!/bin/mksh
ｦｧｨｩｪｫｬ
表
チ
本,マ'
testcase5.output:
#!/bin/mksh
ｦｧｨｩｪｫｬ
表
チ
本,マ

cmd:
cat >> append.txt <<< '表
チ
―ソЫ噂浬欺圭構蚕十申曾箪貼能表暴予禄兔喀媾彌拿杤歃濬畚秉綵臀藹觸軆鐔饅鷭'
testcase6.output:
#!/bin/mksh
本,マ
表
チ
―ソЫ噂浬欺圭構蚕十申曾箪貼能表暴予禄兔喀媾彌拿杤歃濬畚秉綵臀藹觸軆鐔饅鷭

testcase7.testname: redirecting multibyte SJIS character using '<<' (here document)

script.test7.mksh:
#!/usr/bin/mksh
cat << EOF
ｱｲｳｴｵ
ァА
ーゼ
表ソ
‐ゾ
／タ
＼ダ
～Ａ
＋ボ
－ポ
±マ
×ミ
EOF

testcase7.output:
ｱｲｳｴｵ
ァА
ーゼ
表ソ
‐ゾ
／タ
＼ダ
～Ａ
＋ボ
－ポ
±マ
×ミ

testcase8.testname: File and/or directory operations with SJIS multi byte characters
cmd: mkdir ーゼЪ閏骸擬啓梗纂充深措 && echo $?
cd ーゼЪ閏骸擬啓梗纂充深措 && echo $?
touch ーゼЪ閏骸擬啓梗纂充深措/test
echo 'Hello World!' >> ーゼЪ閏骸擬啓梗纂充深措/test
cat ーゼЪ閏骸擬啓梗纂充深措/test
rm -rf ーゼЪ閏骸擬啓梗纂充深措 && echo $?
